Assessment and Plan
1. Shoulder pain.
Impingement sign, pain with cross over manouver, and pain with use of shoulder to extend arm are consistent with rotator cuff injury.
Check shoulder films to exclude acromioclavicular injury or degenerative process.
Renew Vioxx prescription (avoiding NSAIDs) in this patient on prednisone, at risk for gastritis.
2. CAD.
Pt had negative stress MIBI in 12/91 and has not had cardiology follow up for multiple years. She is being referred to the Internal Medicine ward service for consultation. Specifically, she remains on a nitrate (isordil) which may exacerbate GERD. She also merits being placed on an ACE inhibitor to prevent reinfarction.
She is well beta blocked and her BP is well controlled by the current regimen of atneolol and isordil.
Checking fasting lipids.
3. SLE.
She is being followed by Dr. Xie.
She and I are curious about her prednisone dosing and I will discuss the regimen with Dr. Xie.
4. Prednisone.
Had BD of hip last year which was negative; continues on calcium/vitamin D.
Needs further monitoring of HgbA1C as elevated from prior measurements and hyperglycemic from steroids.
5. Mammogram.
Ordered this visit for routine HCM.
6. Pain control.
She has multiple complaints of chronic pain which are not documented in this note. She has used Vioxx previously and needs Stuart Hospital authorization which is being sought following this visit.
7. GERD.
Well-controlled with new regimen of Protonix 40 BID.
8. LE dysesthesias.
Remeasuring A1C but unlikely to have microvascular complications without overt DM.
Starting amitriptyline. Pt educated to take prior to sleep and will reassess if sx alleviated.
9. F/u.
Pt will follow up with me in 3-4 months.
